paragraphs.content: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.

paragraphs.content: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.

paragraphs.content: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I am my beloved’s, and my beloved is mine: he feedeth among the lilies.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Thou art beautiful, O my love, as Tirzah, comely as Jerusalem, terrible as an army with banners.

paragraphs.content: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair is as a flock of goats that appear from Gilead.

paragraphs.content: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy teeth are as a flock of sheep which go up from the washing, whereof every one beareth twins, and there is not one barren among them.

paragraphs.content: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.
paragraphs.contentHtml: As a piece of a pomegranate are thy temples within thy locks.

paragraphs.content: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
paragraphs.contentHtml: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.

paragraphs.content: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.
paragraphs.contentHtml: My dove, my undefiled is but one; she is the only one of her mother, she is the choice one of her that bare her. The daughters saw her, and blessed her; yea, the queens and the concubines, and they praised her.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Who is she that looketh forth as the morning, fair as the moon, clear as the sun, and terrible as an army with banners?

paragraphs.content: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley, and to see whether the vine flourished, and the pomegranates budded.

paragraphs.content: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me like the chariots of Amminadib.

paragraphs.content: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
